ovdesc.p: This table will store details of individual charge or commissions which are being accrued or amortised.
It will normally be updated via a forward accounting entry which will store addtional data related to the accrual process in the multi valued ACCRUAL.DATA field.

desc.p: The unrounded local equivalent of the amount accrued to date in foregin currency. Updated for foregin currency amounts.
The local equivalent of each individual accrual amount will be calculated at the current mid rate and then added to the local amount accrued to date.
Indicates whether the charge amount is being accrued or amortised. A indicates accrual M indicates amortisation.

Can be set by a calling application to indicate that the end.date, charge amount has changed or that accruals need to be reversed.

This no-input field is part of a multivalued set which also includes ACC.AMT.EFF.DATE, ACC.AMT.FCY and ACC.AMT.LCY. This field set is populated by applications with a daily, non-linear accrual method such as Securities Safekeeping, Management/Advisory and Trailer Fees. The set illustrates the schedule to be used for future accruals, allowing for 'catch-up' adjustments for retrospective changes and schedule adjustments relating to Day Basis. The daily accrual processed by core accounting is driven from this field set.

This field shows the Charge Amount used as the basis for calculating ACC.AMT.LCY & ACC.AMT.FCY in the schedule described above. It is an information-only field which is not referenced by core accounting when raising the accrual.

Normally accruals are booked to CAL (CRF or CONSOLIDATE.ASST.LIAB) and to P&L using the P&L category code, i.e the CAL asset type is the same as the P&L category code.
For Arrangement Architecture accruals the CAL entry can be booked using an asset type that differs from the P&L category code.
This field will hold the asset type for AA accruals and if it is not populated the CRF accruals will be booked using the P&L code.
